subject: JS
title: Visions of Israel in Judaism: From Biblical to Modern Times
description: This course surveys the significance of the land of Israel in Judaism from historical, textual, and religious perspectives. Topics covered include the politics of Ancient Israel; the concept of Israel in prayer and the rabbinic and medieval Jewish imagination; portrayals of Israel in Christian and Muslim texts; and the origins, visions, and challenges of Zionism and the modern State of Israel. [Note: This course fulfils an Area 1 requirement for Religious Studies majors.]
